intro: Croton fianarantsoae var. masoalae, commonly known as the Masoala croton, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful foliage. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of the Masoala Peninsula. Its leaves are often variegated with shades of green, red, and yellow, making it visually distinctive. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
